channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在今年几乎所有共和党初选中都碾压了对手。但在金钱竞赛方面，拜登总统比他的前任领先一大截。
item.description:
Donald Trump crushed his opponents in nearly every Republican primary this year. But when it comes to the money race, President Biden has a big head start on his predecessor. https://t.co/XRWgGgxwCQ https://t.co/XRWgGgxwCQ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 在全美房地产经纪人协会同意改变房地产佣金的运作方式后，美国紧张的春季售房季变得更加混乱了
item.description:
America’s stressful spring home-selling season just became even more chaotic after the National Association of Realtors agreed to change how real-estate commissions work https://t.co/9bT7Moaz14 https://t.co/9bT7Moaz14

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 观看：埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的神经链接公司（Neuralink）介绍了第一位接受其脑部计算机植入的患者，并在现场直播中演示了他现在可以使用该设备移动计算机光标下棋。
item.description:
Watch: Elon Musk's Neuralink introduced the first patient to receive its brain-computer implant, demonstrating during a livestream that he can now move a computer cursor to play chess using the device https://t.co/SJZHfCWBhX https://t.co/SJZHfCWBhX

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 当一家连锁医院无法支付账单时发生了什么？供应商停止提供人工膝关节，电梯维修停滞不前，垃圾堆积如山
item.description:
What happened when a hospital chain couldn’t pay its bills: Suppliers stopped delivering artificial knees, elevator repairs stalled and garbage piled up https://t.co/vGDP5jFpkd https://t.co/vGDP5jFpkd

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: Five Below 正在限制自助结账，检查顾客收据，并增加保安人员，以遏制盗窃行为。
item.description:
Five Below is limiting self checkouts, inspecting customer receipts and adding security guards as it seeks to curb theft, which weighed on the retailer’s profit in the latest quarter https://t.co/wzsQh2ahVA https://t.co/wzsQh2ahVA

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 自美联储开始加息以来，现金一直是炙手可热的投资品种，但随着央行考虑削减利率，现金投资的格局正在发生变化。
item.description:
Cash has been a hot investment since the Fed started raising rates, but the landscape is changing as the central bank considers cutting https://t.co/76QI5hCugp https://t.co/76QI5hCugp

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 华尔街日报》的常驻颠覆学家又回来了，在他的 NCAA 锦标赛模型中，有三支球队脱颖而出--还有一些其他的长镜头
item.description:
The Wall Street Journal’s resident upsetologist is back, and three teams stand out in his NCAA tournament model—with a few other longer shots, too https://t.co/qa7QFHhyLF https://t.co/qa7QFHhyLF

item.title: 一名妇女看到枪手放火烧了她孩子所在的房子。另一位妇女抱着新生儿时遭到棍棒殴打。受害者讲述了在苏丹发生大规模屠杀二十年后，达尔富尔发生的新一轮暴行。
item.description:
One woman saw gunmen set fire to the house her children were in. Another was beaten with sticks as she held her newborn. Victims recount the new round of atrocities in Darfur two decades after mass killings in Sudan. https://t.co/Bq8Rjldw9Z pic.twitter.com/ASCcec50Kb

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 当最高法院允许得克萨斯州自行逮捕和驱逐非公民时，美国南部边境的移民规则出现了摇摆不定的局面--直到另一家法院暂时阻止了该州的任何此类努力。
item.description:
The immigration rules governing the southern U.S. border seesawed when the Supreme Court allowed Texas to arrest and deport noncitizens on its own—only for another court to block any such state efforts for now https://t.co/hUBAE6HKnb https://t.co/hUBAE6HKnb

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 安迪-李是一位税务奇才，也是华尔街利润丰厚的利基市场之王。要想完成交易，可真不是件容易的事。
item.description:
Andy Lee is a tax whiz and the king of a lucrative niche on Wall Street. It’s a real grind to get deals done. https://t.co/Ru1iduHAWT https://t.co/Ru1iduHAWT

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 潮一代移民正在重塑住房价格、交通模式、餐厅选择，以及地方政府如何应对他们以前从未处理过的问题：爆炸式增长
item.description:
The boomer migration is reshaping housing prices, traffic patterns, restaurant options and how local governments cope with something they haven’t had to handle before: explosive growth https://t.co/alt2BNOMLo https://t.co/alt2BNOMLo

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: Shein 以开创性的小批量生产模式建立了一个廉价时装王国。现在，它正计划向全球品牌和设计师开放。
item.description:
Shein has built a bargain fashion empire with a pioneering small-batch manufacturing model. Now it is planning to open that up to global brands and designers. https://t.co/0NuRUPaRuK https://t.co/0NuRUPaRuK

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 这对刚刚退休的夫妇没有兴趣再进行另一项建筑工程。于是，他们在明尼阿波利斯市中心买下了一个原始的阁楼空间，并花费大约 400 万美元进行了大规模翻新。
item.description:
The recent retirees had no interest in embarking on another construction project. Then they bought a raw loft space in downtown Minneapolis and spent roughly $4 million on an extensive renovation. https://t.co/c9KY2WN8y3 https://t.co/c9KY2WN8y3

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 宅在家里的闺蜜们在 TikTok 上上传了大量关于自我保健、烹饪、清洁的视频，以及对传统婚姻的理想化憧憬--少了结婚戒指
item.description:
Stay-at-home girlfriends have flooded TikTok with videos of self-care, cooking, cleaning and an idealized vision of a traditional marriage—minus the wedding ring https://t.co/5iayDVlYnS https://t.co/5iayDVlYnS

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 拳击手奥斯卡-德拉霍亚（Oscar De La Hoya）在拉斯维加斯再下一城--这一次，他将在拉斯维加斯建造一座豪华住宅，其中包括一个价值 40 万美元的私人洞穴和一个向其职业生涯致敬的房间。
item.description:
Boxer Oscar De La Hoya is going another round with Las Vegas—this time with a tricked out home with features like a $400,000 man cave and a tribute room that pays homage to his career https://t.co/3jXlRG5Ofo https://t.co/3jXlRG5Ofo

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 他重振了 Old Spice。这位首席执行官能否拯救一款失去风度的运动鞋？
item.description:
He revived Old Spice. Can this CEO save a sneaker that lost its cool? https://t.co/PgTqosoeB4 https://t.co/PgTqosoeB4

item.title: 现在可以通过皮肤活检来诊断帕金森病，这种活检可以检测出帕金森病患者神经内的一种异常蛋白质。"皮肤检测基本上就是大脑的一扇窗"。
item.description:
Parkinson’s disease can now be diagnosed with a skin biopsy that can detect an abnormal protein people with Parkinson’s have inside their nerves.

“The skin test basically is a window into the brain." https://t.co/rxT0u9XL6A https://t.co/rxT0u9XL6A

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 美国周三在海地用直升机营救了十几名美国人。美国国务院表示，政府包租的直升机航班每天将空运至少30名美国人。
item.description:
The U.S. rescued more than a dozen Americans in Haiti by helicopter on Wednesday. The State Department said at least 30 Americans will be airlifted by the government-chartered helicopter flights daily. https://t.co/rmSPTWesVg

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 🎧 听：在今天的《The Journal》播客中，@cdriebusch 解释了为什么 Reddit 更热情的用户会在该平台首次登陆股市时给它带来麻烦。

item.title: 许多 Z 世代意外地找到了生活在数百或数千英里之外的浪漫伴侣。这个不太可能的媒人就是 Discord 平台。
item.description:
Many Gen Z’ers are unexpectedly finding romantic partners who live hundreds or thousands of miles away. The unlikely matchmaker is the platform Discord. https://t.co/tBUVPjrgJG https://t.co/tBUVPjrgJG

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：战争结束后，以色列人可能会有心情思考最符合本国长期利益的政策。威廉-加尔斯顿写道，在此之前，舒默等美国领导人的建议将被充耳不闻。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: After the war ends, Israelis may be in a mood to think about the policies that would best serve their country's long-term interests. Until then, advice from American leaders such as Schumer will fall on deaf ears, writes William Galston. https://t.co/YtH7b1Zsxi

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：@TomRtweets写道：莫斯科希望记者甚至评论员在没有事先考虑到克里姆林宫利益的情况下害怕开展工作
item.description:

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 由埃隆-马斯克创办的脑计算机初创公司 Neuralink 介绍了第一位接受脑计算机植入的患者，29 岁的诺兰-阿尔博（Noland Arbaugh）。
item.description:
Neuralink, the brain-computer startup founded by Elon Musk, introduced the first patient who received its brain-computer implant, 29-year-old Noland Arbaugh https://t.co/8IIgDfyBVI https://t.co/8IIgDfyBVI

item.title: 周三公布的一份执法报告显示，全球航运高管安吉拉-赵（Angela Chao）在得克萨斯州驾驶特斯拉汽车冲入池塘溺亡时，体内酒精含量接近法定限度的三倍。
item.description:
Global shipping executive Angela Chao had nearly three times the legal limit of alcohol in her system when she drove a Tesla into a pond and drowned in Texas, according to a law-enforcement report released Wednesday https://t.co/XRBFchk7L3 https://t.co/XRBFchk7L3

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 20, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：左派将不断增长的西班牙裔选民视为民主党的可靠投票群体。@jasonrileywsj写道，他们没有认识到的是，西班牙裔往往将经济利益置于种族身份之上。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The left saw the growing Hispanic electorate as a reliably Democratic voting bloc. What they failed to acknowledge is that Hispanics tended to put economic interests above their ethnic identity, writes @jasonrileywsj. https://t.co/rCHoggxinf

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 20, 2024

item.title: "人们意识到，不住在洛杉矶或纽约也没关系"。亚特兰大大都会区长期以来一直是嘻哈艺术家、音乐家和职业运动员的聚集地，如今已成为电影和电视行业的圣地。
item.description:
“People realized it was OK to not live in L.A. or New York.” Long a hub for hip-hop artists, musicians and pro athletes, the Atlanta metro area has become a mecca for the film and TV industries. https://t.co/pIaaic7sse https://t.co/pIaaic7sse

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 20, 2024

item.title: 众议院议长迈克-约翰逊（Mike Johnson）表示，他希望尽快推进立法，以避免政府在本周末停摆
item.description:
House Speaker Mike Johnson indicated he wants to move ahead quickly with legislation to avoid a government shutdown this weekend https://t.co/StJkPFgTZ9 https://t.co/StJkPFgTZ9

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 20, 2024
